ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Find the position of an astronomical object using NED or CDS.

SYNTAX.LINE: ra and dec are in decimal degrees, coordsys is a string

DESC.PARA: The identify_name routine calls the Astronomical name resolver provided by the Canadian Astronomy Data Center (CADC), or if this is not working, the Sesame service from the Centre de Donn√©es astronomiques de Strasbourg.

Given a name, it returns the Right Ascension, Declination, and coordinate system. If no position can be found then a ValueError is raised. This call requires a working internet connection, and so may fail (e.g. if both services are temporarily unavailable).
The routine can be loaded into a Python session or script by saying:
Here we find the position of Sirius.

SYNTAX.LINE: ValueError: No position found matching the name 'made up name'.

DESC.PARA: If a position is not recognized then a ValueError is raised.

ADESC.title: Changes in the scripts 4.12.2 (April 2020) release
ADESC.PARA: The routine now falls back to using the Sesame service from Simbad if the CADC server fails.

ADESC.title: Changes in the scripts 4.10.3 (October 2018) release
ADESC.PARA: The routine now uses the service at http://www.cadc-ccda.hia-iha.nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/cadc-target-resolver rather than http://www1.cadc-ccda.hia-iha.nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/NameResolver because problems were seen with the automatic redirects for some queries.

ADESC.title: Changes in the scripts 4.5.4 (August 2013) release
ADESC.PARA: The routine now uses the service at http://www.cadc-ccda.hia-iha.nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/NameResolver rather than the more-specific version previously used: http://www1.cadc-ccda.hia-iha.nrc-cnrc.gc.ca/NameResolver.
